title: Manolo prepares FC Goa for ACL2 tie in Baghdad with season still uncertain | Goa News
body_text:
Trending
Panaji: It didn’t escape Manolo Marquez’s eyes that FC Goa players were distracted during training last week.For months now, they’ve been training, but competitive games have been few and far between. Four games in the AFC Champions League Two, Asian football’s second-tier club competition, and three group-stage games in the Super Cup. That’s all.There’s another one now in Baghdad on Wednesday, Super Cup semifinal against Mumbai City early next month, and the concluding ACL2 group clash on Christmas eve. If the uncertainty surrounding the season continues to drag, the players will start having major doubts about the new year.“Every individual reacts differently to situations, but you can’t ignore what’s happening (in Indian football),” Manolo, the experienced Goa coach, told TOI after a training session at Bambolim. “We speak everyday (about the situation). The other day during training, I summoned the team and told them we have two options: one, to have pity about a situation we have no control, and the other is to build a stronger group, compete well and arrive in the best condition for every game.
